## What is Github?
### How is it relevant to Psychology researchers?

- *As developers*
  - Share your hardwork with others
    - Tasks: CC, CS, RS...
    - Useful tools: automailer, convert-Eprime, R-prime 
    - List of resources: awesomeR, awesomePython
    - Open-source data: JHU Covid-19 data
- *As users*
  - Benefit from the hardwork of others
    - [fmriprep] (https://github.com/poldracklab/fmriprep)
    - [NeuroKit] (https://github.com/neuropsychology/NeuroKit)
  - Follow updates of functions (R, Python)
    - [tidyverse] (https://github.com/tidyverse)
    - [easystats] (https://github.com/easystats)
    - [spm] (https://github.com/spm)
  - Raise issues when encountered
    - https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/issues
